meanings.definition: A person who keeps records of financial transactions.
meanings.sent1: The bookkeeper at the store records all the sales.
meanings.sent2: The bookkeeper balanced the company's accounts at the end of the month.
meanings.sent3: The bookkeeper made sure every penny was accounted for, even the ones found under the couch cushions.
meanings.sent4: She was like a bookkeeper of memories, meticulously storing each moment in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The bookkeeper's ledger was as neat and organized as a library catalog.

meanings.sent1: Our bookkeeper keeps track of all the expenses and income for the business.
meanings.sent2: The bookkeeper's job is crucial for ensuring the company's financial health.
meanings.sent3: The bookkeeper joked that counting money all day was like playing a never-ending game of Monopoly.
meanings.sent4: She was the bookkeeper of our group, always remembering who owed what to whom.
meanings.sent5: The bookkeeper's attention to detail was as sharp as a pencil point.
